svg.style: font-family:Lato, 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, 'Liberation Sans', sans-serif;font-feature-settings:"liga", "kern", "calt", "lnum";text-rendering:geometricPrecision;-webkit-font-smoothing:antialiased;font-size:18px;background-color:#ffffff

a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Total shortfall from a poverty line of $2 a day (before tax), 1970 to
This is the amount of money that would be theoretically needed to lift the incomes of all people in poverty up to $2 per day.
This data is adjusted for inflation and differences in living costs between countries. Income here is measured before taxes

Note: This data is expressed in
international-$
at 2021 prices. This shortfall does not take into account costs and inefficiencies from making
